column1: 3,https://macsources.com/xreart-apple-watch-1st-generation-frame-2023-review/,b5be32649e3f4856ba3132621ba18b0e,us,en,2023-05-01T13:40:26+00:00,Xreart Apple Watch 1st Generation Frame 2023 REVIEW,Xreart is a photography studio that creates artwork featuring deconstructed Apple products. The pieces feature the iconic logo and silhouette of Apple devices like iPhones
column2: laptops
column3: and iPads taken apart to expose the intricate components underneath. Xreart makes their frames available in two different types of wood and use high-quality tempered glass as opposed to acrylic panels. In addition to the premade pieces
column4: XreART also offers DIY kits for customers to assemble their own art frames. The X reart Apple Watch 1st Generation Frame has a list price of $219.00 but is currently on sale for $199.00 from xreart.com. I would recommend it to any Apple fan.,Xreart does a tear-down of classic electronic devices and frames them as artwork.,"In recent years
column5: there has been an ever-growing trend of artwork featuring deconstructed Apple products. These pieces often feature the iconic logo and silhouette of Apple devices like iPhones
column6: laptops
column7: and iPads taken apart to expose the intricate components underneath. This type of artwork is a unique and interesting way to bring a bit of tech into your home. For people who appreciate the beauty in both high-tech gadgets and traditional artwork
column8: this combination provides a perfect balance. Having artwork featuring deconstructed Apple products not only looks cool and modern
column9: but it can also be meaningful in other ways.

column1: Last year
column2: I was introduced to this type of artwork in the form of a frame that featured a deconstructed iPhone. This artwork now hangs in my fiancé’s office and I knew that if I had the opportunity to install one for my workspace that I would choose the Apple Watch. Xreart made this possible.

column1: Xreart is a photography studio that was established in 2019 that focuses on product photography. Xreart does a tear-down of classic electronic devices and frames them as artwork. Some of the pieces they create include iPhones
column2: Game Boy
column3: XBOX
column4: Switch
column5: PSP
column6: and the Apple Watch. These ‘frames’ are then defined as artwork and are suitable as collectables and room decorations. They also make great gifts.

column1: Xreart makes their frames available in two different types of wood — European Beech and Walnut. Both are more durable and scratch-resistant than other product deconstruction art pieces. They also use high-quality tempered glass as opposed to acrylic panels. This not only ensures a sophisticated look as well as a light transmission rate of 92.5%.
The Xreart frames have a specially designed back clasp to prevent the bottom lock of the frames from popping off and scratching the frames during transportation. In addition to the premade pieces
column2: Xreart also offers DIY kits for customers to assemble their own art frames. This sets them apart from other competitors in the same space.

column1: The Xreart Apple Watch 1st Generation Frame has a list price of $219.00 but is currently on sale for $199.00 from xreart.com.

The Xreart Apple Watch Frame arrived in a designed-style shipping box. The presentation of the product is impeccable and is one of the reasons it would make an awesome gift for any Apple fan. The frame comes with hanging hardware that is easy to use. There is no assembly required and aside from removing protective film from the front of the frame
column2: it’s ready to be installed.

column1: It’s a nostalgic experience having the original Apple Watch hanging on my wall. I remember jumping out of my skin when Apple announced it for the first time in 2015. I grew up watching Inspector Gadget and always wanted their communicator watches. Apple Watch made that a reality. So
column2: the Xreart Apple Watch 1st Generation Frame was given to me.

column1: The artwork is made well. The watch is mounted on a backboard that includes printed labels on all the parts that are exposed. Even though Apple Watch had several options for watch bands
column2: the original Fluoroelastomer Sport Band in black is what is included with the frame. An interesting option might be for users to have the option to select the band color they want to be included. Since Xreart creates these pieces of artwork from discarded devices
column3: I understand why giving users the option to select watch series or individual components is difficult
column4: but I would think the watch band itself would be fairly easy to find.

column1: Since I have already had some experience with Xreart’s competitor
column2: GRID Studio
column3: I naturally saw some similarities between the two pieces of artwork. I do not own the Apple Watch art from GRID
column4: but they include detailed photos on their website. The two pieces have the same basic layout for the deconstructed Apple Watch and the biggest visual difference between the two is the quote. The GRID Studio art also includes a reproduction of Steve Jobs’s autograph
column5: the Xreart version does not.

column1: Another big difference between the two artwork options is that Xreart offers users the option to purchase DIY kits. The kits come complete with labeled backing
column2: tools
column3: and frame. I found this to be an interesting option because it gives users the opportunity to preserve their own products. I would have loved to be able to keep my first iPhone. And while I no longer have that device
column4: I do have an original iPhone 3GS that I could tear down and mount using an Xreart kit.

column1: I am very impressed with the quality of the Xreart’s Apple Watch Frame and I would recommend it to any Apple fan. I really love that they offer people the chance to create their own works of art with their DIY kits. I’m interested to see what Xreart offers next.
For more information
column2: visit xreart.com
column3: Facebook
column4: or Instagram.",macsources.com,0.056892075,0.015679242,0.92742866,Robyn,[],False,,0

column1: Airdrop is my top favorite feature on Apple devices. Sure

column1: How to start using AirDrop
To start using AirDrop
column2: you must be signed in with your Apple ID
column3: and go to settings to make sure Wi-Fi and Bluetooth are enabled

column1: When you’re ready to share something – in this example
column2: I am going to send a photo from my photos app – go to the photos app and then select the item you want to send.

column1: You’ll see the AirDrop icon. From there
column2: you can choose the person you want to share with. You can even use AirDrop to share things between your own devices.

column1: Now
column2: here’s something to be careful of. If the person you want to share with appears as someone other than a nearby AirDrop user
column3: make sure their AirDrop is on and allowed to receive items in their Control Center.

column1: How to Grant Access to your AirDrop
To allow others to send items to your iPhone using AirDrop
column2: simply open Control Center by swiping down on your screen in the top right corner.

column1: Touch and hold the top-left corner in the group of controls\.
Then tap the AirDrop icon. From there
column2: you can choose whom you want to receive items from. You can even accept or decline each request as it arrives.

column1: These instructions also apply to iPads. To share items from a Mac desktop or laptop
column2: simply right-click the item
column3: scroll to the “share” option
column4: and select AirDrop.

column1: IS YOUR APPLE AIR TAG ABOUT TO DIE?
How to change your AirDrop name on your Apple Devices
Customizing your AirDrop name is pretty basic and can help others identify you whenever attempting to airdrop in a crowded place such as a shopping center or theme park.
To change your AirDrop name on your iPhone
column2: open your Contacts app

column1: Tap your name at the top of the list
column2: and then tap Edit.

column1: From there
column2: you can delete your first name
column3: enter a new one
column4: and save the changes. Easy.

column1: Now
column2: changing your AirDrop name is much simpler if you’re using an iPad
column3: and all you have to do is go to Settings.

column1: Tap “General
column2: ” then “About
column3: ” and finally
column4: “Name.” Delete your current name
column5: enter the new one
column6: and voilà. You’re done. Your iPad name will now appear the same on another Apple user’s screen whenever someone attempts to AirDrop you something.

column1: Last but not least
column2: changing your AirDrop name is just as easy if you’re using a Mac.

column1: Go to the “Apple” menu in the top left corner of your screen and click System Preferences.
Finally
column2: Computer Name. Delete your current name and enter the new one
column3: and you’re good to go.

column1: How to Grant Access to your AirDrop
To allow others to send items to your iPhone using AirDrop
column2: simply open Control Center by swiping down on your screen in the top right corner.

column1: Touch and hold the top-left corner in the group of controls\.
Then tap the AirDrop icon. From there
column2: you can choose whom you want to receive items from. You can even accept or decline each request as it arrives.

column1: These instructions also apply to iPads. To share items from a Mac desktop or laptop

column1: IS YOUR APPLE AIR TAG ABOUT TO DIE?
How to change your AirDrop name on your Apple Devices
Customizing your AirDrop name is pretty basic and can help others identify you whenever attempting to airdrop in a crowded place such as a shopping center or theme park.
To change your AirDrop name on your iPhone
column2: open your Contacts app

column1: Tap your name at the top of the list
column2: and then tap Edit.

column1: From there
column2: you can delete your first name
column3: enter a new one
column4: and save the changes. Easy.

column1: Now
column2: changing your AirDrop name is much simpler if you’re using an iPad
column3: and all you have to do is go to Settings.

column1: Tap “General
column2: ” then “About
column3: ” and finally
column4: “Name.” Delete your current name
column5: enter the new one
column6: and voilà. You’re done. Your iPad name will now appear the same on another Apple user’s screen whenever someone attempts to AirDrop you something.

column1: Last but not least
column2: changing your AirDrop name is just as easy if you’re using a Mac.

column1: Go to the “Apple” menu in the top left corner of your screen and click System Preferences.
Finally
column2: Computer Name. Delete your current name and enter the new one
column3: and you’re good to go.

column12: apple cider vinegar is rich in many nutrients of its own. The fermented juice that comes from apples has an active ingredient that experts say may marginally help with weight loss
column13: and the product has some other health benefits

column1: But apple cider vinegar is not the magic weight loss answer some promote it to be
column2: and some medical professionals have soured on overpromoting its benefits while research is ongoing. Still
column3: there are at least a few known advantages of occasionally including the vinegar in one’s diet
column4: and almost no known harms.

column1: As its name suggests
column2: apple cider vinegar is literally vinegar made from apples. It’s produced by pressing apples into apple juice
column3: then allowing it to ferment.

column1: The yeast and water blend is often mixed with sugar and has become a popular ingredient in foods such as pickles
column2: salad dressings
column3: and marinades. It’s sometimes sold in pill
column4: gummy
column5: or powder form
column6: but is most commonly purchased in grocery stores as a pasteurized
column7: clear
column8: and filtered product.

column1: An unfiltered form of the liquid is also available. This type includes a thick
column2: cloudy layer of probiotic bacteria on the surface of the vinegar known as “the mother.”

column1: What are the health benefits of apple cider vinegar?
“The mother” layer of apple cider vinegar contains probiotics that are promoted as being good for gut health
column2: but supporting research is sparse. Acetic acid is the main active ingredient in apple cider vinegar (and in other types of vinegar) and has been associated with positive health outcomes such as reducing some risk factors associated with heart disease.

column1: Josh Redd
column2: NMD
column3: author of “The Truth About Low Thyroid
column4: ” says additional research shows consuming apple cider vinegar may also help lower cholesterol
column5: “particularly in people with Type 2 diabetes.” The vinegar is also rich in magnesium
column6: potassium
column7: phosphorus
column8: and calcium
column9: which are essential minerals for health and proper organ function. And apple cider vinegar is packed with antioxidants that scavenge free radicals from one’s blood cells to prevent or reduce illness or disease.

column1: Can apple cider vinegar help you lose weight?

Apple cider vinegar has also been connected with aiding weight loss. Such assertions usually include a small study that found that consuming the vinegar could prevent obesity by improving metabolism and inflammation issues. Lisa Young
column2: PhD
column3: an adjunct professor of nutrition at New York University and author of “Finally Full
column4: Finally Slim
column5: ” says the vinegar has also been shown to “increase feelings of fullness which in turn can decrease appetite.” She says the suggested amount of apple cider vinegar to take daily should be no more than 1-2 tablespoons.

column1: “Consuming apple cider vinegar with meals may also help reduce blood sugar spikes and improve insulin sensitivity
column2: which can help promote weight loss
column3: ” explains Redd
column4: but adds that such research is ongoing. Until more conclusive results come in
column5: he says one can still glean some of the other health benefits of the product safely so long as doses remain small. Even then
column6: “because of its high acidity
column7: apple cider vinegar can erode tooth enamel over time and should be diluted with water
column8: ” he suggests.

column1: Barbara Olendzki
column2: RD
column3: associate professor of population and quantitative health sciences at UMass Chan Medical School
column4: agrees that diluting the product is wise and says that while the vinegar is “no magic bullet” against obesity
column5: there is some ongoing research that suggests it may beneficially help one’s gut microbiome. “And that is very important in losing weight
column6: ” she says.

The future model of the Apple Watch Ultra will therefore still have to make do with an OLED screen. It was previously expected that the successor to the current Apple Watch Ultra would be Apple’s first device with a micro-LED screen. That plan is now off the table. But why exactly?

The fact that Apple has now chosen to postpone the new micro-LED screens is probably due to technical problems. It is quite difficult to make these screens and the costs of this production process are very high. So it’s up to Apple to find a way to make the screens affordable.

column1: 49,https://www.marinij.com/2023/05/01/sausalito-serves-as-setting-for-new-apple-tv-show/,31070cb5029247d98ac15f2e19c139cd,us,en,2023-05-02T01:26:35+00:00,Sausalito serves as setting for new Apple TV+ show,Sausalito
column2: the setting for a new Apple TV+ series starring Jennifer Garner
column3: is set to star as a newly married woman living on a floating home in the city. The show features iconic locations such as Liberty Dock and the Marin Headlands
column4: as well as iconic scenes such as Waldo Point Harbor
column5: Yellow Ferry Dock
column6: City Hall and Caledonia Street. The Sausalito houseboat was replicated on a stage in Los Angeles for the inside shots
column7: using floating walls and an interior not subject to the elements. The city is no stranger to the arts
column8: its rich bohemian heritage goes back almost a century.,“The Last Thing He Told Me
column9: ” which centers on a family who lives in a floating home
column10: includes many of the city’s famous sights.,"Sausalito is the backdrop of a new Apple TV+ series starring Jennifer Garner.

column1: The show
column2: based the bestselling novel “The Last Thing He Told Me” by Laura Dave
column3: started on April 14 and features iconic locations such as Liberty Dock and the Marin Headlands.

column1: “I’m always interested in highlighting a community that’s on the edge of the world in some way
column2: ” said Dave
column3: who lives in Los Angeles. “I sort of fell in love with it. It was such a beautiful community and the people had such a sense of community there.”

column1: The story centers on Hannah
column2: a newly married woman played by Garner
column3: who lives on a floating home in Sausalito with her husband Owen and his 16-year-old daughter Bailey. When Owen disappears
column4: the pair have to bridge their tenuous relationship to solve the mystery of his disappearance.

column1: Sausalito’s characteristics as an insulated coastal community buttressed its choice as a location in the story. Dave said the floating home neighborhood appeared to require “something different of its inhabitants” and could be a place where “someone would choose to hide.”
“Part of the journey of the show is that Sausalito is so important to the two main characters
column2: ” she said. “It’s a way to get back to the happiness that they know there.”

column1: Opening scenes feature the Sausalito docks
column2: the shimmering bay and rows of homes illuminated. The married couple stroll along the water and an ominous man lingers in the background. After sunrise
column3: a red Dodge truck winds through the city interspersed with sweeping dock views
column4: fluttering birds and a fog-laden image of the Golden Gate Bridge.

column1: The show features locations such as Waldo Point Harbor
column2: Yellow Ferry Dock
column3: City Hall and Caledonia Street
column4: along with shots of Bridgeway at Easterby Street and Princess Street. Poggio
column5: an Italian restaurant
column6: is mentioned as a favorite of Hannah’s.

column1: The houseboat was used as the home of Paul Avery
column2: the character Robert Downey Jr. played in the film “Zodiac
column3: ” and as the home of Dax Shepard’s character in the TV show “Parenthood.”

column1: “People have just really embraced the book and seem to love how Sausalito is portrayed
column2: which means a lot to me
column3: ” Dave said.

column1: Josh Singer
column2: Dave’s husband and a producer for the show
column3: previously worked as a writer on “The West Wing” and “Fringe.” As showrunner
column4: he worked with the writers to generate a script and oversaw its development to the screen.

column1: Singer said the Sausalito houseboat was replicated on a stage in Los Angeles for the inside shots
column2: using floating walls and an interior not subject to the elements.

column1: “Sausalito leaves a very strong imprint on the viewer
column2: ” Singer said. “We really wanted to get a sense of place and a sense of community in Sausalito.”

column1: The city is no stranger to the arts. Its rich bohemian heritage goes back almost a century
column2: said Louis Briones
column3: executive director of the Sausalito Art Festival Foundation and co-director of Sausalito Center for the Arts.

column1: An established art center in the city drew visual artists in the 1930s. The “Sausalito Six” — Richard Diebenkorn
column2: Frank Lobdell
column3: Walter Kuhlman
column4: John Hultberg
column5: James Budd Dixon and George Stillman — dominated headlines as a collective in the late 1940s. Jean Varda led the city’s reputation as an art colony on the waterfront
column6: Briones said.

column1: “It continues with organizations like the Sausalito Art Festival and Sausalito Center for the Arts
column2: which has taken the mantle
column3: ” Briones said. “We’re moving the art colony’s history forward.”

column1: Cheryl Popp
column2: owner of Sausalito Books by the Bay
column3: said Dave did book signings at the shop.

column1: “Obviously Sausalito offers an absolutely stunning set and stage from any sort of novel. What more inspirational place to write a book or film a movie?” Popp said.
The famed Marin author Isabel Allende has featured the city in many of her books. Other authors to do include Jack London and Jack Kerouac. Sterling Hayden
column2: the 1950s and 1960s actor
column3: was a resident of the city and set much of his memoir
column4: “The Wanderer
column5: ” there. Barbara Sapienza wrote a novel called “Anchor Out” set in Richardson Bay
column6: and Rick Seymour’s “Murder on the Dock of the Bay” is also set in Sausalito.

column1: The Jean Varda-era attracted Beat writers Allen Ginsberg
column2: Gary Snyder and Rod McKuen
column3: who wrote an ode titled “Back to Sausalito.”

column1: “We are thrilled to see this thriller showcase our picturesque
column2: charming village to the world through an Apple TV+ series
column3: ” said Mayor Melissa Blaustein. “To us
column4: it’s home
column5: not a movie set
column6: but I can see why a film director would think otherwise.”",marinij.com,0.04608191,0.053743836,0.90017426,Giuseppe Ricapito,"[{'country': 'us', 'state': 'CA', 'county': 'Marin County'}]",False,CA,0

column1: Commenting on a wide array of themes -- consumerism

column4: farmers' distress

column6: and we believe that it is through these connections that we can create art that is meaningful and impactful.""

column1: Adding that they recognise that times are changing and that their ways of working must evolve to stay relevant and effective
column2: Tagra believes it is essential to be part of the system to bring about meaningful change. ""And we are committed to using our art to challenge the status quo. Ultimately

column5: and of inspiring people to see the world in a new and exciting way.""

column1: The project with Apple also took them back to their archives where they revisited their work of the past two decades.

The duo says it was exciting to draw on their own archive of artworks as a starting point for the installation as the same contains a wealth of fragments and pieces that we have carefully researched and built up over the years
column2: each one capturing a different aspect of the city of Mumbai and its many layers.

column3: to the works based on speculation and dreams

column6: inspiring visitors to see it with fresh eyes and engage with its many facets

column1: Tagra adds that every time they delve into their archives

column3: present
column4: and future

column6: we can open up new possibilities for dialogue
column7: engagement
column8: and understanding
column9: and we look forward to seeing the many ways in which it will inspire and inform this project.""

column2: to generate unique imagery based on the user’s inputs. The user experience is critical to the success of the installation. Thukral says their goal was to create an interface that seamlessly integrates aesthetics and functionality
column3: allowing users to interact with the installation in a way that is both engaging and visually satisfying.

column1: To achieve this
column2: they used cutting-edge technology to create a responsive interface that is both fast and reliable. “We partnered with creative coder
column3: Kiel M
column4: to help us develop an engine. Overall
column5: our aim was to create an installation that meets the highest standards of aesthetics and functionality
column6: while also delivering a truly memorable and engaging user experience
column7: ” says Thukral.

column1: Stressing that they choose projects that allow them to get outside their comfort zones and which offer something new to learn
column2: Tagra asserts
column3: “We like to push our understanding. We try different mediums to expand the scope of what art can do. it’s a deep dive sometimes the results are extremely satisfying.”

column1: Commenting on a wide array of themes — consumerism
column2: GST
column3: water woes
column4: farmers’ distress
column5: the duo belongs to a select group of artists not holding back when commenting on the contemporary social and political scenario.

column1: Thukral believes art is a powerful marker of time
column2: reflecting the social
column3: cultural
column4: and political context in which it is created. “As artists
column5: must respond to the world around us and engage with the issues and concerns of our time. We come from humble middle-class backgrounds and have always believed in staying grounded by connecting with grassroots-level projects. We understand the importance of engaging with the communities that inspire our work
column6: and we believe that it is through these connections that we can create art that is meaningful and impactful.”

column1: Adding that they recognise that times are changing and that their ways of working must evolve to stay relevant and effective
column2: Tagra believes it is essential to be part of the system to bring about meaningful change. “And we are committed to using our art to challenge the status quo. Ultimately
column3: we see our work as a way of connecting with others
column4: sparking dialogue and engagement
column5: and of inspiring people to see the world in a new and exciting way.”

column1: The project with Apple also took them back to their archives where they revisited their work of the past two decades.

The duo says it was exciting to draw on their own archive of artworks as a starting point for the installation as the same contains a wealth of fragments and pieces that we have carefully researched and built up over the years
column2: each one capturing a different aspect of the city of Mumbai and its many layers.

column1: From the basalt rock that forms the bedrock of the city
column2: to the species found in Rani Bagh botanical gardens
column3: to the works based on speculation and dreams
column4: their archives boasted of a broad and diverse range of inspiration for this project. “By combining these elements in new and unexpected ways
column5: we hope to bring a sense of wonder and excitement to the city on the move
column6: inspiring visitors to see it with fresh eyes and engage with its many facets
column7: ” says Thukral.

column1: Tagra adds that every time they delve into their archives
column2: they are struck by the overwhelming sense of history and reverie that it contains. “It is a living record of the city’s past
column3: present
column4: and future
column5: and we are honoured to have the opportunity to draw on it to create something truly unique and special. We believe that by sharing our archive with visitors
column6: we can open up new possibilities for dialogue
column7: engagement
column8: and understanding
column9: and we look forward to seeing the many ways in which it will inspire and inform this project.”

column1: For them
column2: it has always been fascinating to create a work that gets ‘completed’ when it is inhabited or activated in some way. Their latest installation explores the idea of creating a ‘song’ that can only be heard when the space is inhabited or engaged with by visitors.

column1: “The concept of this work is based on the idea that sound is not just something that we hear
column2: but something that we feel and experience. By creating a space that is designed to be activated by visitors
column3: we hope to create a rich and immersive sensory experience that captures the essence of the city on the move
column4: ” say the duo who is also working on new gameplays
column5: another book and researching for a new show at Sharjah later this year.",newsroomodisha.com,0.10644332,0.015826944,0.8777298,Newsroom Odisha Network,[],True,,0

Apple thanked the jury in a statement and will now ask the court to dismiss the remaining claims.,Apple and Masimo failed to persuade a jury to reach a unanimous verdict in a trial where the medical-devices company claimed a blood-oxygen sensor in the Apple Watch was developed using misappropri…,"Apple and Masimo failed to persuade a jury to reach a unanimous verdict in a trial where the medical-devices company claimed a blood-oxygen sensor in the Apple Watch was developed using misappropriated trade secrets.

column1: Masimo sought as much as $1.85 billion
column2: claiming that was the amount of illegal profit Apple earned from using its technology. But jurors in federal court in Santa Ana
column3: California
column4: told the judge Monday they were unable to reach a consensus
column5: with six out of seven panelists voting to clear the iPhone maker of wrongdoing.

column1: “We’re not going to be able to come to a joint conclusion
column2: ” the all-female panel wrote in its final note to the judge. Earlier
column3: the jury said six of its members voted for Apple and one for Masimo
column4: and she refused to change her mind. US District Judge James Selna declared a mistrial late Monday afternoon.

column1: It’s unusual for jurors to report on a vote in their closed-door deliberations as judges routinely warn them against doing so.
Masimo Corp. and Cercacor Laboratories Inc.
column2: a Masimo spinoff that owns certain licensing rights to many Masimo patents
column3: sued Apple claiming it misappropriated trade secrets related to technology that uses light sensors to measure the amount of oxygen in the bloodstream for use in its Apple Watch.

column1: Masimo initially sought as much as $3.1 billion
column2: claiming that was the amount Apple improperly benefited from its technology. The judge rejected several of Masimo’s claims before the jury began deliberations
column3: reducing the potential maximum payout Apple faced to $1.85 billion.

column1: Apple poached Masimo and Cercacor employees to learn about its technology after Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook nixed an internal proposal to buy the company
column2: Masimo’s lawyer
column3: Joseph Re
column4: told the jury in closing arguments.

column1: Apple responded by brining forward numerous employees who had worked on the sensor project
column2: all of whom told the jury during the three-week trial that Masimo’s technology wasn’t used in the development.

column1: In his closing argument
column2: Apple’s lawyer
column3: Joe Mueller
column4: invited the employees one by one to stand
column5: repeating over and over they “told you the truth.”

column1: After the mistrial was declared Apple thanked the jury in a statement.
“We deeply respect intellectual property and innovation and do not take or use confidential information from other companies
column2: ” the company said. “We are pleased that the court correctly rejected half of the plaintiffs’ trade secret allegations
column3: and will now ask the court to dismiss the remaining claims.”

column1: Re declined to comment on the mistrial and said it was too early to say if Masimo would seek another trial.
“It’s been a very emotional day
column2: ” he said.

column1: The 3 1/3 days of jury deliberations were also marked by emotion.
In a note last week
column2: the jury said one of the panelists would leave the room and pace the hallway outside
column3: while another juror cried.

column1: A single mother with a temporary job
column2: earning about $25
column3: 000 a year
column4: was excused Friday after telling the judge she couldn’t afford to spend another week deliberating because she wasn’t being paid for her time on the jury.",rickztalk.com,0.025974676,0.84435016,0.12967512,Rickzamit05,[],True,,0

column2: Masimo Smartwatch Trade Secrets Lawsuit Ends in Mistrial: Details,A US judge in California has declared a mistrial in Masimo's smartwatch trade secret lawsuit against Apple after jurors failed to reach a unanimous verdict in the potential billion-dollar case. The jury had been asked to determine whether Cupertino
column3: California-based Apple misused confidential information from Masimo related to the use of light to measure biomarkers including heart rates and blood oxygen levels. column4: reduced from its initial request for $3.1 billion (roughly Rs.17 crore) in damages after the judge dismissed some of its trade-secret claims during trial. Apple is facing another potential Apple Watch import ban in a separate patent fight with Mountain View
column5: California's medical device maker AliveCor over heart-monitoring technology.,A US judge in California on Monday declared a mistrial in Masimo’s smartwatch trade secret lawsuit against Apple after jurors failed to reach a una...,"A US judge in California on Monday declared a mistrial in Masimo’s smartwatch trade secret lawsuit against Apple after jurors failed to reach a unanimous verdict in the potential billion-dollar case.

column1: A Masimo spokesperson said in a statement that the company was “disappointed that the jury was unable to reach a verdict” but intends to retry the case.
The jury in federal court in Santa Ana had been asked to determine whether Cupertino
column2: California-based Apple misused confidential information from Masimo related to the use of light to measure biomarkers including heart rates and blood oxygen levels.

column1: The jury began deliberating on April 26 after a trial lasting about three weeks before US District Judge James Selna.
Apple said in a statement that it “deeply respects intellectual property and innovation and does not take or use confidential information from other companies
column2: ” and will ask the court to dismiss the remaining claims in the case.

column1: Irvine
column2: California-based Masimo and its spinoff Cercacor Laboratories Inc sued Apple in 2020
column3: accusing it of stealing trade secrets and using them to create and sell several Apple Watch models.

column1: The lawsuit claimed Masimo representatives met with Apple in 2013 about integrating its inventions into Apple products and that Apple subsequently hired away two executives – one from Masimo and one from Cercacor – and used their knowledge to copy the technology.
Masimo asked for more than $1.8 billion (roughly Rs. 147.17 crore) in damages
column2: reduced from its initial request for $3.1 billion (roughly Rs. 253.45 crore) after the judge dismissed some of its trade-secret claims during trial.

column1: Apple in a court filing called Masimo’s lawsuit a “maneuver to clear a path” for its own smartwatch. Apple sued Masimo in Delaware last year
column2: accusing it of patent infringement.

column1: Smartwatches
column2: mobile devices worn on the wrist with an array of capabilities
column3: are a lucrative market
column4: with global sales worth tens of billions of dollars.

column1: Masimo has also sued Apple at the US International Trade Commission over Apple Watch imports that it said violated its patent rights. An ITC judge preliminarily ruled in favor of Masimo in January
column2: which could lead to an import ban on infringing Apple Watches if the full commission affirms the decision.

column1: Apple is facing another potential Apple Watch import ban in a separate patent fight with Mountain View
column2: California-based medical device maker AliveCor over heart-monitoring technology.

column1: DSCC analyst Ross Young tweeted that Apple would release an Apple Watch with a microLED display in the second half of 2025 at the earliest. column2: iPad

column1: At present

column3: the next-generation display brings improved resolution
column4: colour contrast
column5: and the ability to be better seen at an angle. Apple is also reportedly planning to start using its own screens for the iPhone and Apple Watch. Using in-house displays would reduce Apple’s dependency on companies like Samsung Electronics and LG.

column1: Samsung is also reportedly eying to adopt microLED displays for its future Galaxy series wearables. The South Korean electronics manufacturer currently uses OLED displays for its Galaxy smartwatches.

The updates are being released across the next 48 hours so give it some time if it hasn't appeared on your device yet.,Apple has recently released Rapid Security Response (RSR) updates available to all iPhone and iPad users running iOS 16.4.1 and Mac users running macOS 13.3.1
column4: marking the first time the company ha…,"Apple has recently released Rapid Security Response (RSR) updates available to all iPhone and iPad users running iOS 16.4.1 and Mac users running macOS 13.3.1

column1: The Rapid Security Response updates are released in order to provide users with security fixes without the need to install a full software update. The iOS response update is available through the software update page in the ‌iPhone‌ or ‌iPad‌ settings app. It only takes a few minutes to complete and will quickly restart the user’s phone. Mac users can find the update under system settings.

iOS 16.4.1 users who complete the update will be greeted with an updated version of the software. The ‘about’ section of the phone’s settings will give information about the installed iOS version and the Rapid Security Response update.

Apple has been toying with implementing RSRs for a while now. The company introduced the updates with the launch of iOS 16 and macOS Ventura but has only provided updates to beta testers to ensure the function worked properly.
The function will be available only to those who are running the latest versions of iOS
column2: macOS and iPadOS in the future.

column1: Wistron

column1: As an Apple supplier

column4: the Taiwanese firm is said to be moving out.

column1: According to sources cited by Hindu BusinessLine
column2: Wistron will be mostly withdrawing from India
column3: and will probably approach the National Company Law Tribunal and the Registrar of Companies to dissolve its operations within a year.

column1: The effort has already seemingly started
column2: with Tata Electronics seeking to take control of Wistron's Karnataka iPhone production facility
column3: which is also Wistron's main operation in India.

column1: The factory became a problem for Wistron in December 2020
column2: after employees rioted over allegations of shorted pay. The incident led to Apple putting Wistron on probation.

column1: Sources claim that once the takeover of the iPhone arm is complete
column2: Wistron will start the process of winding down.

column1: It is also said that Wistron will also wait for more subsidy payments from the Mobile PLI scheme set up by the government to encourage production
column2: before shutting down.

column1: While Wistron employs over 12
column2: 000 people in India
column3: not all will lose their jobs over time. The majority of Wistron's employees work under the iPhone unit that Tata is in the process of acquiring.

column3: it now seems that these won't necessarily come to fruition

The story so far
Way back in 2013
column2: Apple reportedly contacted medical tech company Masimo
column3: as it was interested in forming a “working relationship” with the company. Following meetings in which details of Masimo’s pulse oximeter technology was discussed
column4: Apple is said to have begun poaching the company’s staff.

column1: One 2013 hire
column2: confirmed at the beginning of 2014
column3: was Masimo’s chief medical officer
column4: Dr. Michael O’Reilly.

column2: Masimo filed a lawsuit officially accusing Apple of stealing trade secrets
column3: and infringing ten of the company’s patents
column4: in the O2 sensor in the Apple Watch.

column1: The dispute between the two companies escalated later the same year
column2: when the Apple Watch Series 6 launched with a new blood oxygen detection feature. Masimo asked the US International Trade Commission to ban imports of the new model.

column1: That attempt failed
column2: but earlier this year a court ruled that Apple had indeed infringed one of the ten patents. The Cupertino company is trying to have the decision overturned
column3: with a final ruling expected next month. Apple also hit back
column4: accusing Masimo of making an Apple Watch clone.

column1: A report last month claimed that Apple paid Masimo’s chief medical officer millions of dollars in stock to poach him.
Of the ten infringement claims made by Masimo
column2: Apple says that the judge rejected five of them
column3: leaving the jury to decide on the remaining five.

column1: Bloomberg reports that while six of the seven jurors found that Apple had not infringed any of Masimo’s patents
column2: the remaining juror disagreed. The jury eventually concluded that it would not be possible to reach a unanimous verdict
column3: and sent a note to the judge informing him of this.

column1: Masimo said that it was disappointed by the result
column2: and – despite Apple coming close to winning – the company intends to file for a retrial.

column1: Apple said it was pleased by the partial win.
Masimo revealed that Apple had at one point planned to acquire the company
column2: but CEO Tim Cook decided against this. Apple
column3: for its part
column4: put forward “numerous employees who had worked on the sensor project” to testify that they had not used Masimo’s tech in the development of the O2 sensor in the Apple Watch.

column1: Whether Masimo will actually file for a retrial remains to be seen. Having come so close to losing the case
column2: it would seem a risky thing to do.

column1: The health tech company does still hold out hope that the US International Trade Commission might ban imports of the Apple Watch
column2: based on its separate finding that Apple did infringe one patent
column3: with a final decision to be made later this month. That decision was likely to be influenced by the result of this case – which we now don’t (officially) have.

column1: Normally
column2: we wouldn’t know anything more than the fact that the jury was unable to reach agreement. It’s unusual for a jury to reveal the split in its view

column1: 94,https://www.fool.com/investing/2023/05/02/apple-earnings-what-to-watch/,347938a8fb87462db5f175714f0018ed,us,en,2023-05-02T12:31:00+00:00,Apple Earnings: What to Watch,Apple is set to report its fiscal second-quarter earnings report on Thursday
column2: with the most high-profile report likely to be Apple's (AAPL -0.05). For its first quarter of fiscal 2023
column3: Apple's revenue fell 5% year over year to $117.2 billion
column4: due to a challenging environment due to inflation
column5: the war in Ukraine
column6: and lingering impacts from the pandemic. Analysts are in agreement with Apple's guidance
column7: with their expectations for the direction of its revenue falling 4.6%. Finally
column8: Apple typically uses its fiscal Q2 update to authorize more capital for share repurchases and to announce a dividend increase.,The tech company is expected to report another year-over-year decline in revenue.,"This week will be packed with earnings reports from tech companies. But the most high-profile report will be Apple's (AAPL -0.05%). The tech giant reports earnings on Thursday. Given its nearly $2.7 trillion market capitalization
column9: its report could have a big influence on the overall market.

column1: Ahead of the iPhone maker's fiscal second-quarter earnings report
column2: here's an overview of its recent performance and some key items to check on after the update goes live.

column1: For its first quarter of fiscal 2023
column2: Apple's revenue fell 5% year over year to $117.2 billion. Apple CEO Tim Cook said in the company's earnings call for the period that the decline was ""a result of the challenging environment ...""

column1: What
column2: exactly
column3: did this challenging environment consist of? One of the main contributors was a huge foreign exchange impact. Foreign exchange rate headwinds negatively impacted the company's year-over-year growth rate by about 800 basis points. Indeed
column4: Apple would have reported year-over-year growth in most of its markets if it excluded this headwind
column5: Cook explained during the call. Sales were also held back by supply chain challenges
column6: which led to production of its new iPhones being substantially lower than planned during the quarter. Finally
column7: management cited ""a challenging macroeconomic environment"" due to inflation
column8: the war in Ukraine
column9: and lingering impacts from the pandemic.

column1: Given the continued uncertainty in the macroeconomic environment
column2: management said it expected a similar year-over-year growth rate in its revenue in fiscal Q2.

column1: Analysts
column2: for the most part
column3: seem to be in agreement with Apple's guidance. On average
column4: they expect the tech company's fiscal Q2 revenue to fall 4.6% year over year -- a growth rate that's not too far from what Apple reported in fiscal Q1. The consensus forecast for Apple's earnings per share is $1.43 -- a 6% year-over-year decline. This year-over-year change would be an improvement from the 10.5% decline in earnings per share Apple saw in fiscal Q1.

column1: One number that could really move the stock when Apple reports is management's revenue outlook. The current analyst estimate calls for fiscal Q3 revenue of $84.3 billion. Importantly
column2: this would mark a return to year-over-year growth for the company. While Apple has been avoiding providing a specific guidance figure during its earnings reports recently
column3: it has been providing some commentary about its expectations for the direction of its revenue. During Apple's fiscal Q2 earnings call
column4: look for the company to say it expects its revenue to return to growth in fiscal Q3.

column1: Finally
column2: Apple typically uses its fiscal Q2 update to authorize more capital for share repurchases and to announce a dividend increase. Last year
column3: Apple boosted its dividend by 5% and authorized an additional $90 billion for share repurchases. Shareholders are likely hoping Apple announces another significant increase to its share-repurchase authorization and another dividend increase.

column1: The tech giant is scheduled to report its fiscal Q2 results after market close on Thursday
column2: May 4. Investors will be able to find the earnings release on Apple's investor relations website.",fool.com,0.01036754,0.9704329,0.019199625,Daniel Sparks,[],False,,0

column2: analyzed through machine learning
column3: can accurately assess a person’s mental resilience and well-being. This suggests a future where psychological states can be remotely monitored without mental health questionnaires
column4: potentially enhancing access to mental health services. The findings were published in the May 2nd issue of JAMIA Open. To determine if machine learning models could be trained
column5: the researchers analyzed data from the Warrior Watch Study and conducted a digital observational study of 329 healthcare workers enrolled at seven hospitals in New York City. The research team plans to continue using wearable data to observe a range of physical and psychological disorders and diseases.,A study has demonstrated that machine learning algorithms applied to data passively collected from wearable devices can be used to gauge an individual’s mental resilience and psychological well-being. The findings suggest that devices such as the Ap,"Wearable devices may be a means to monitor psychological states through effortless data collection using artificial intelligence. column1: Apple’s new Rapid Security Response update is a mess. With broken apps and bogus error messages
column2: the whole thing seems a bit half-baked.

column1: No doubt it’s important to install. But
column2: in today’s SB Blogwatch
column3: we’re in the dark—because there aren’t any release notes.

column1: Your humble blogwatcher curated these bloggy bits for your entertainment. Not to mention: Hidden patterns inside cheese.
RSR RSI — but Keep Trying
A Rapid Security Response update is a special kind of update that doesn’t require users to perform a normal software update. Instead of a lengthy update procedure
column2: the update can instead be quickly downloaded and installed within minutes. … This can include fast fixes for urgent security issues
column3: such as actively used exploits … to mitigate risks of infection or data loss.

column1: So far … every attempt to update has been met with a warning that the device cannot verify the security response [and] that the device is “no longer connected to the internet” (when that isn’t the case). This may be a case of server load
column2: but the download is very small.

column1: When an RSR is applied
column2: the update adds a letter to the end of the version number
column3: for example turning iOS 16.4.1 to iOS 16.4.1 (a). … RSR installation can be disabled
column4: with the content of the RSR rolled into the next standard software update.

column1: Initially
column2: a good many iPhone users were unable to install the update. They got an error message that said that the device was ‘unable to verify security response’ because it was not connected to the internet
column3: even though that wasn’t the case.

column1: The rollout is staggered. … So if you still haven’t received it or are still having trouble installing it
column2: the issue will likely be resolved in the next 48 hours.

column1: Not very rapid if they take just as a long as a regular software update—lol.
However
column2: dhinakg disputes the theory it’s because of a staggered rollout:

column1: This error is not related to ramping. Ramping (aka phased rollouts) is basically when automatic update notification is delayed on a schedule.
There’s an error with Apple’s update signing server (TSS). … This is likely a screwup for the first public RSR and should be fixed in a few hours
column2: just give it a bit. Guess Apple should’ve provided a more specific string for Tatsu rejection than just using the generic “no longer connected to the internet.”

column1: Got yours yet? John Gruber notes another faux pas:
I’ve seen a few of these RSR updates while running beta versions of iOS
column2: but I suspect those were all just tests from Apple of the RSR delivery and update mechanisms. It’s a great new mechanism for Apple
column3: but one that they’d only use for truly significant bugs — ones they realize are being actively exploited in the wild
column4: or could be to deeply detrimental effect.

column1: [But it] seems a little weird that today’s RSR updates aren’t listed yet on Apple’s security updates page. In recent years Apple has been very diligent about updating this page. … These new RSR updates seem to exist outside this documentation system for now.
Is there a downside? Yes
column2: if you’re in the middle of something
column3: as niij nudges:

column1: Warning: If you install this it doesn’t give you the option to delay a reboot to apply the update. I got a notification my computer would be restarting in 60 seconds as soon as the install completed.

A rushed Apple update years ago [bricked] all of the machines that installed it in the initial hours before the problem was discovered. The employee responsible is probably managing a Cinnabon location in Ohama today under Witness Protection.

column2: HomeKit thinks I’m not home and I can’t seem to fix it. I’m about three motion alerts away from uninstalling it.

119,https://n-cryptech.com/apple-google-team-up-to-tackle-bluetooth-tracker-stalking-terror/,010b6a30592b42a992d1f3bb23c19792,us,en,2023-05-02T15:42:00+00:00,Apple
column2: Google team up to tackle Bluetooth tracker-stalking terror,Apple and Google have jointly announced a new industry specification that will prevent Bluetooth location-tracking devices from being used to track people without permission. The draft specification
column3: filed with the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF)
column4: includes feedback from device manufacturers
column5: input from various safety and advocacy groups. It is intended to make it possible for iOS and Android smartphones to detect unauthorized Bluetooth tracking devices to protect individuals against unwanted surveillance. Apple has responded in several ways
column6: including better warnings for iPhone users in the event they have an unknown tag moving with them
column7: but none of these protections are completely foolproof. The specification also offers best practices and instructions for manufacturers
column8: should they choose to build these capabilities into their products.,The days when people can be abusively tracked using devices such as Apple's AirTags may be numbered
column9: both Apple and Google today jointly announced work on a,"The days when people can be abusively tracked using devices such as Apple’s AirTags may be numbered
column10: both Apple and Google today jointly announced work on a new standard that will prevent this from happening and hinted that Android users will soon be able to tell whether they’re being tracked by an AirTag.

column1: The two companies say they have been working on a new industry specification to help prevent Bluetooth location-tracking devices being used to track people without permission. They also seem to have the industry behind them
column2: as Samsung
column3: Tile
column4: Chipolo
column5: eufy Security
column6: and Pebblebee have all expressed support for the draft specification
column7: which has been filed with the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF).

column1: The idea is to make it possible for iOS and Android smartphones to detect unauthorized Bluetooth tracking devices to protect individuals against unwanted surveillance. In addition to incorporating feedback from device manufacturers
column2: input from various safety and advocacy groups has been integrated into the development of the specification.

column1: Erica Olsen
column2: senior director of the National Network to End Domestic Violence’s Safety Net Project said in a statement: “These new standards will minimize opportunities for abuse of this technology and decrease the burden on survivors in detecting unwanted trackers.”

column1: In the same statement
column2: Alexandra Reeve Givens
column3: the Center for Democracy & Technology’s president and CEO
column4: explained that one of the keys to protecting against this kind of abuse is
column5: “a universal
column6: OS-level solution that is able to detect trackers made by different companies on the variety of smartphones that people use every day.”

column1: What problem does this solve?

Ever since Apple introduced AirTags the ether has been populated by horrific tales of various unpleasant uses of the tracking devices. While these devices are great because they link to Apple’s FindMy network and make it really easy to locate lost or stolen devices (NYPD recently gave away 500 of them to help protect against car crime)
column2: some have abused them to track people in malicious ways.

column1: These have ranged from car thieves tracking vehicles they intend to steal to abusive partners monitoring their victims. Apple has responded in several ways
column2: including better warnings for iPhone users in the event they have an unknown tag moving with them. That system will alert you if a tag is found. But none of these protections are completely foolproof
column3: and some are platform specific — the warnings an iPhone user sees are not shared with Android
column4: for example.

column1: That’s part of what the specification tries to solve. It will allow Bluetooth location-tracking devices to be compatible with unauthorized tracking detection and alerts across iOS and Android platforms. The draft specification also offers best practices and instructions for manufacturers
column2: should they choose to build these capabilities into their products.

column1: It means that you’ll be able to use AirTags and other Bluetooth tracking devices to track your items
column2: not to track people.

column1: What Apple and Google said
“Apple launched AirTag to give users the peace of mind knowing where to find their most important items
column2: ” said Ron Huang
column3: Apple’s vice president of sensing and connectivity. “We built AirTag and the Find My network with a set of proactive features to discourage unwanted tracking — a first in the industry — and we continue to make improvements to help ensure the technology is being used as intended.

column1: “This new industry specification builds upon the AirTag protections
column2: and through collaboration with Google results in a critical step forward to help combat unwanted tracking across iOS and Android
column3: ” Huang said.

column1: “Bluetooth trackers have created tremendous user benefits
column2: but they also bring the potential of unwanted tracking
column3: which requires industry-wide action to solve
column4: ” said Dave Burke
column5: Google’s vice president of engineering for Android. “Android has an unwavering commitment to protecting users
column6: and will continue to develop strong safeguards and collaborate with the industry to help combat the misuse of Bluetooth tracking devices.”

column1: Of course
column2: part of the reason Apple
column3: Google and the industry have agreed to work together is because they recognize that until individual privacy is protected few are likely to adopt these technologies. But manufacturers of connected devices want to nurture this adoption as they attempt to add features to their products.

column1: What happens next?
The specification process works like this
column2: nowthat the draft has been submitted to the IETF.

column1: • For the next three months
column2: interested parties can review and comment on the proposals.

column1: • Apple and Google will then resolve any problems raised during the review.
• They will then introduce what’s called a production implementation of the specification by the end of 2023.
• The two companies will then support that specification in future versions of iOS and Android.
It isn’t yet clear whether we can anticipate the specification being finalized and shipping as an OS update to supported platforms by the end of this year or in 2024
column2: though if the standardizing process works well
column3: perhaps it’s not too long before another stalking nightmare is terminated.

This new message informs folks that using this item to track people is indeed a criminal offense in most places around the world.,Apple and Google want to put a stop to the misuse of Bluetooth gadgets like AirTags and Tile trackers.,"Apple and Google are teaming up to fight AirTag and Tile bluetooth tracker stalking by proposing an industry specification. This specification is intended to “alert users in the event of suspected unwanted tracking
column4: ” according to the official press release. Location-tracking devices can be a godsend
column5: especially when you misplace your keys or wallet. However
column6: they can be used for far more nefarious reasons like stalking and car theft. However
column7: this proposed specification is meant to squash the misuse of these tracking devices.

column1: So
column2: how will this standard work? Well
column3: it would allow Bluetooth-enabled gadgets to be compatible with unauthorized tracking detection and alerts across both iOS and Android ecosystems. They’ve already got the support of Tile
column4: Samsung
column5: Eufy Security
column6: Pebblebee
column7: Chipolo
column8: and more. Apple and Google submitted this proposed specification to the Internet Engineering Task Force (otherwise known as IETF)
column9: which is a standards organization that was established back in 1986. Interested parties are currently being invited to review and comment on the proposal over a period of three months. Once they’ve gone over the feedback
column10: they’ll release a production implement of the specification
column11: which is expected by the end of 2023.

column1: Since the release of the new AirTags in 2021
column2: Apple has gone ahead and implemented a couple of new anti-stalking features. The device will now producer louder alert sounds when separated from from its owner. You’ll also see a warning message when setting up the AirTag for the first time. This new message informs folks that using this item to track people is indeed a criminal offense in most places around the world. While these changes are no doubt important
column3: Google and Apple seem to be taking things a step further. This is great news
column4: as safety should always be a top priority.",dejkala.com,0.14758123,0.021198895,0.8312199,hasibul,[],True,,0

column1: 128,https://rickztalk.com/apple-google-team-up-to-tackle-bluetooth-tracker-stalking-terror/,9437f8e5136645409a22f7045380f326,us,en,2023-05-02T16:06:22+00:00,Apple
column2: Google team up to tackle Bluetooth tracker-stalking terror,Apple and Google have jointly announced a new industry specification that will prevent Bluetooth location-tracking devices from being used to track people without permission. The draft specification
column3: filed with the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF)
column4: includes feedback from device manufacturers
column5: input from various safety and advocacy groups. It is intended to make it possible for iOS and Android smartphones to detect unauthorized Bluetooth tracking devices to protect individuals against unwanted surveillance. Apple has responded in several ways
column6: including better warnings for iPhone users in the event they have an unknown tag moving with them
column7: but none of these protections are completely foolproof. The specification also offers best practices and instructions for manufacturers
column8: should they choose to build these capabilities into their products.,The days when people can be abusively tracked using devices such as Apple’s AirTags may be numbered
column9: both Apple and Google today jointly announced work on a new standard that will prevent thi…,"The days when people can be abusively tracked using devices such as Apple’s AirTags may be numbered
column10: both Apple and Google today jointly announced work on a new standard that will prevent this from happening and hinted that Android users will soon be able to tell whether they’re being tracked by an AirTag.

column1: The two companies say they have been working on a new industry specification to help prevent Bluetooth location-tracking devices being used to track people without permission. They also seem to have the industry behind them
column2: as Samsung
column3: Tile
column4: Chipolo
column5: eufy Security
column6: and Pebblebee have all expressed support for the draft specification
column7: which has been filed with the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF).

column1: The idea is to make it possible for iOS and Android smartphones to detect unauthorized Bluetooth tracking devices to protect individuals against unwanted surveillance. In addition to incorporating feedback from device manufacturers
column2: input from various safety and advocacy groups has been integrated into the development of the specification.

column1: Erica Olsen
column2: senior director of the National Network to End Domestic Violence’s Safety Net Project said in a statement: “These new standards will minimize opportunities for abuse of this technology and decrease the burden on survivors in detecting unwanted trackers.”

column1: In the same statement
column2: Alexandra Reeve Givens
column3: the Center for Democracy & Technology’s president and CEO
column4: explained that one of the keys to protecting against this kind of abuse is
column5: “a universal
column6: OS-level solution that is able to detect trackers made by different companies on the variety of smartphones that people use every day.”

column1: What problem does this solve?

Ever since Apple introduced AirTags the ether has been populated by horrific tales of various unpleasant uses of the tracking devices. While these devices are great because they link to Apple’s FindMy network and make it really easy to locate lost or stolen devices (NYPD recently gave away 500 of them to help protect against car crime)
column2: some have abused them to track people in malicious ways.

column1: These have ranged from car thieves tracking vehicles they intend to steal to abusive partners monitoring their victims. Apple has responded in several ways
column2: including better warnings for iPhone users in the event they have an unknown tag moving with them. That system will alert you if a tag is found. But none of these protections are completely foolproof
column3: and some are platform specific — the warnings an iPhone user sees are not shared with Android
column4: for example.

column1: That’s part of what the specification tries to solve. It will allow Bluetooth location-tracking devices to be compatible with unauthorized tracking detection and alerts across iOS and Android platforms. The draft specification also offers best practices and instructions for manufacturers
column2: should they choose to build these capabilities into their products.

column1: It means that you’ll be able to use AirTags and other Bluetooth tracking devices to track your items
column2: not to track people.

column1: What Apple and Google said
“Apple launched AirTag to give users the peace of mind knowing where to find their most important items
column2: ” said Ron Huang
column3: Apple’s vice president of sensing and connectivity. “We built AirTag and the Find My network with a set of proactive features to discourage unwanted tracking — a first in the industry — and we continue to make improvements to help ensure the technology is being used as intended.

column1: “This new industry specification builds upon the AirTag protections
column2: and through collaboration with Google results in a critical step forward to help combat unwanted tracking across iOS and Android
column3: ” Huang said.

column1: “Bluetooth trackers have created tremendous user benefits
column2: but they also bring the potential of unwanted tracking
column3: which requires industry-wide action to solve
column4: ” said Dave Burke
column5: Google’s vice president of engineering for Android. “Android has an unwavering commitment to protecting users
column6: and will continue to develop strong safeguards and collaborate with the industry to help combat the misuse of Bluetooth tracking devices.”

column1: Of course
column2: part of the reason Apple
column3: Google and the industry have agreed to work together is because they recognize that until individual privacy is protected few are likely to adopt these technologies. But manufacturers of connected devices want to nurture this adoption as they attempt to add features to their products.

column1: What happens next?
The specification process works like this
column2: nowthat the draft has been submitted to the IETF.

column1: • For the next three months
column2: interested parties can review and comment on the proposals.

column1: • Apple and Google will then resolve any problems raised during the review.
• They will then introduce what’s called a production implementation of the specification by the end of 2023.
• The two companies will then support that specification in future versions of iOS and Android.
It isn’t yet clear whether we can anticipate the specification being finalized and shipping as an OS update to supported platforms by the end of this year or in 2024
column2: though if the standardizing process works well
column3: perhaps it’s not too long before another stalking nightmare is terminated.

Find out if it's worth getting or if you should pick another credit card.,"Many or all of the products here are from our partners that compensate us. It’s how we make money. But our editorial integrity ensures our experts’ opinions aren’t influenced by compensation. Terms may apply to offers listed on this page.

column1: Apple often does a fantastic job of marketing its products. Who doesn't remember those mid-2000s iPod commercials? The Apple Card is no exception. The tech giant claims to have ""completely reinvented the credit card
column2: and it had 6.7 million cardholders as of 2022.

column1: The Apple Card is a rewards card available exclusively to iPhone users that earns Daily Cash
column2: which is cash back you receive the same day you make a purchase. Last month
column3: Apple added another big perk for cardholders with its Savings account
column4: a high-yield savings account offering a 4.15% APY.

column1: However
column2: it's a crowded credit card marketplace with a lot of great options available. If you're thinking about signing up for this Apple credit card
column3: you should know what it offers and how it stacks up to the competition.

column1: The Apple Card has several cool features that make it stand out from other cards. For one
column2: there are no fees. That means no annual fee
column3: no late fees
column4: and no foreign transaction fees.

column1: The only potential extra cost is interest. But when you're ready to make a payment
column2: Apple Card shows you an estimate of how much interest you'll pay over time based on the payment amount you enter. That's helpful
column3: as you get to see exactly how much credit card interest can cost you.

column1: The most valuable perk of the Apple Card is Daily Cash. Most cash back credit cards send you your cash back once per month after the billing cycle closes. Apple does it every day. Here are the Apple Card's cash back rates:
• 3% Daily Cash back at Apple and at select merchant partners when you use Apple Pay (current partners include Uber
column2: Walgreens
column3: and T-Mobile)

column1: What makes this Daily Cash even better is that you can now pair your Apple Card with a Savings account from Goldman Sachs. The account has no fees
column2: no minimum deposits
column3: and no minimum balance requirements. And its 4.15% APY is comparable to the best savings account rates.

column1: Once you set up a Savings account
column2: you can have your Daily Cash deposited into it automatically. This makes it easy and convenient to earn a high interest rate on your cash back.

column1: Another perk of the Apple Card is that it lets you pay for new Apple products over time
column2: interest-free. You can pay off purchases in monthly installments for six to 24 months
column3: depending on the product.

column1: Why the Apple Card isn't quite a slam dunk
The Apple Card doesn't have any glaring flaws
column2: but it does fall short of the top credit cards in a few areas.

column1: Its biggest drawback is that it doesn't have a sign-up bonus. Many rewards cards have sign-up bonuses you earn if you reach a spending minimum. For example
column2: some cash back cards offer a $200 bonus to new cardholders who spend $500 in the first three months.

column1: Depending on your spending habits
column2: you may also be able to earn more back with a different card. The Apple Card is pretty limited in terms of bonus categories
column3: earning 3% Daily Cash on purchases with Apple and its merchant partners. Other cash back cards earn 3% to as high as 6% in broader bonus categories
column4: such as gas and groceries
column5: dining
column6: or entertainment.

column1: Is the Apple Card worth it?
The Apple Card is a good choice if you like Apple products and you want to keep your finances as simple as possible.
If you use Apple Pay for most purchases
column2: then you'll earn 2% Daily Cash on that spending
column3: which is a competitive rate. And Apple takes practically all the work out of managing your credit card rewards since you can have your Daily Cash automatically transferred to a Savings account.

column1: I'd recommend checking out other options before you apply for an Apple Card
column2: though. You might find that there are cash back cards that better fit your spending habits. For example
column3: if you spend a lot on groceries
column4: one of the best grocery credit cards could offer more value. It's always worth comparing multiple cards before picking one to ensure you're making the right choice.",fool.com,0.059764553,0.018505158,0.9217302,Lyle Daly,[],False,,0

column1: 131,https://finance.yahoo.com/news/1-google-apple-working-together-161353069.html,ed58303874ae41b4b7fac09325b0ad42,us,en,2023-05-02T16:13:53+00:00,Google
column2: Apple working together to fight unwanted tracking,Google and Apple Inc have submitted a draft draft with specifications that will require all Bluetooth location-tracking devices to alert users of any unauthorized tracking on both iOS and Android devices. The specifications include feedback from device manufacturers
column3: safety and advocacy groups
column4: and an Android detector app to help users scan nearby AirTags or other similar item trackers that might be traveling with them without their knowledge. Apple and Google have also announced plans to ban the use of location tracking in apps that use a contact tracing system meant to help slow the spread of the coronavirus.,Alphabet Inc-owned Google and Apple Inc said on Tuesday they were working together to curb unwanted tracking of people by Bluetooth devices such as AirTags used for finding lost items. The companies together have submitted a draft with specifications that will require all Bluetooth location-tracking devices to alert users of any unauthorized tracking on both iOS and Android devices. Feedback from device manufacturers as well as various safety and advocacy groups has been integrated into the specifications
column5: the companies said
column6: adding that have support from companies such as Samsung Electronics and consumer electronics company Tile.,"May 2 (Reuters) - Alphabet Inc-owned Google and Apple Inc said on Tuesday they were working together to curb unwanted tracking of people by Bluetooth devices such as AirTags used for finding lost items.

column1: The companies together have submitted a draft with specifications that will require all Bluetooth location-tracking devices to alert users of any unauthorized tracking on both iOS and Android devices.
Feedback from device manufacturers as well as various safety and advocacy groups has been integrated into the specifications
column2: the companies said
column3: adding that have support from companies such as Samsung Electronics and consumer electronics company Tile.

column1: Since the launch of AirTags
column2: privacy experts and law enforcement have said some people use it for criminal or malicious purposes.

column1: AirTags are intended to be slipped into or attached to keys
column2: wallets
column3: backpacks and other items so people can find them when they are lost.

column1: In an effort to boost privacy
column2: Apple in 2021 had launched an Android detector app to help users scan nearby AirTags or other similar item trackers that might be traveling with them without their knowledge.

column1: Earlier in 2020
column2: Apple and Google also said they would ban the use of location tracking in apps that use a contact tracing system meant to help slow the spread of the coronavirus. (Reporting by Tiyashi Datta in Bengaluru
column3: Editing by Shinjini Ganguli)",finance.yahoo.com,0.07032416,0.032275446,0.8974004,Reuters,[],True,,0

154,https://www.learndaily.thats.im/apple-is-still-battling-iphones-batterygate-throttling-controversy/2023/,1becd91de5364713bff3f067d76ee092,us,en,2023-05-02T16:33:27+00:00,Apple is still battling iPhone’s Batterygate throttling controversy,Apple is currently battling a $2 billion lawsuit in the United Kingdom over its controversial decision to throttle older iPhones as their battery health degraded. The lawsuit accuses Apple of “hiding defective batteries in millions of iPhones” by throttling the performance of those devices. Apple argued that this lawsuit is “baseless” and said that most iPhone batteries were not defective. The company has also acknowledged that a “small number of iPhone 6s models” did have defective batteries
column2: but those users were offered free battery replacements. Apple has also rolled out new features to iOS designed to mitigate the long-term degradation of battery health
column3: but Apple seems keen to keep fighting it.,Years later
column4: Apple is still facing ramifications for its controversial decision to throttle older iPhones as their battery health degraded. As reported today by Reuters
column5: Apple is currently battling…,"Years later
column6: Apple is still facing ramifications for its controversial decision to throttle older iPhones as their battery health degraded. As reported today by Reuters
column7: Apple is currently battling a $2 billion lawsuit in the United Kingdom over this decision
column8: arguing that the case is “baseless.”

column1: It’s seemingly the fight that Apple will never truly be able to end…

This lawsuit accuses Apple of “hiding defective batteries in millions of iPhones” by throttling the performance of those devices. This is a little bit different than some of the other Batterygate lawsuits we’ve seen over the years because of that accusation that the batteries were defective.
The lawsuit is valued at 1.6 billion pounds plus interest
column2: which equates to around $2 billion. Reuters reports that the lawsuit is being led by “consumer champion Justin Gutmann on behalf of iPhone users in the United Kingdom.” Lawyers representing Gutmann argue that “concealed issues with batteries in certain phone models and ‘surreptitiously’ installed a power management tool which limited performance.”

column1: In its written response
column2: Apple argued that this lawsuit is “baseless” and said that most iPhone batteries were not defective. The company did
column3: however
column4: acknowledge that a “small number of iPhone 6s models” did have defective batteries
column5: but those users were offered free battery replacements.

column1: As for its decision to throttle performance based on battery health
column2: Apple said that it “only reduced an iPhone 6’s performance by an average of 10%.”

column1: Apple has faced lawsuits around the world over the Batterygate controversy. The company’s practice of throttling older iPhones based on performance was first discovered in 2017 by sleuthing users on Reddit and a subsequent 9to5Mac report. Apple agreed to pay $500 million to settle a United States lawsuit over the matter. It also agreed to pay $113 million to settle a separate multi-state investigation.
At the time
column2: Apple was forced to issue a public apology
column3: offer discounted battery replacements
column4: and give users the choice of whether or not to enable the feature. Since then
column5: the company has also rolled out new features to iOS designed to mitigate the long-term degradation of battery health.

column1: It remains to be seen where this United Kingdom lawsuit will ultimately lead
column2: but Apple seems keen to keep fighting it.",learndaily.thats.im,0.015359412,0.91295743,0.07168315,learn,[],True,,0
